pageContext.description: Thin delicate blade; two rivet holes, one broken away; point apparently missing; blade flat.
pageContext.patina: Rough green in patches; the blade end retains its original smooth metallic surface of almost golden colour.
pageContext.other: Length shows "2-9/10in." Width shows "1 inch". Weight shows "1/4oz."
pageContext.associations: With cremated burial in large inverted cinerary urn with 2 handles & finger-tip decorations; a secondary ? interment
pageContext.publications: Wilts Arch. Mag. Dec 1929. Vol.45 p.82.,Devizes Museum Cat. Part 2, 2nd Edition, p.51. Pl=XIV,Loddard's List,Wilts Arch. Mag. Vol.38. page 213-4.,DM 808,GC527
pageContext.site: County Wilts,Bromham Parish,Roundway Down,Barrow on extremity of hill outside Oliver's Camp; i.e. Barrow 2
pageContext.toSearch: Roundway Down, Swindon, Swindon, Swindon Sn5, UK
pageContext.remarks: Accidentally revealed by rabbits burrowing at edge of mound.,Seen
